pr_title: fix(iot-dev): Fix issue where amqp layer didn't recognize an ack to a subscription message that it sent

timeline.message: fix(iot-dev): Fix issue where amqp layer didn't recognize a subscription message that it sent

timeline.bodyText: Without the above changes, this ack handling logic would fall to the else block and log an error
timeline.author: timtay-microsoft

replies.bodyText:
Why does the log say: "re-sent amqp subscription message"?
I thought what we do here is -> if we receive an ack from service for the subscription message, we remove it from our internal queue, so as to not resend it. Is that not correct?
replies.author: abhipsaMisra

replies.bodyText: This log statement gets executed when we receive an ack for an outstanding subscription message that we sent. It does get removed from the queue of outstanding messages as a result. The only odd thing about this subscription message is that it is sent at the session level. That's why this new queue needed to be added for messages like it
replies.author: timtay-microsoft

timeline.bodyText: This new map will track outstanding subscription messages. I couldn't re-use the inProgressMessages map because there is no transport agnostic message to add to that map since we are creating the amqp message directly. Plus, messages in that map are expected to have a matching message in the IotHubTransport layer, which isn't the case for this special amqp-specific subscription message
timeline.author: timtay-microsoft

timeline.bodyText: This is orthogonal to the actual PR, but this log message had one too many spots for parameters, so I got rid of it
timeline.author: timtay-microsoft

timeline.bodyText: Update constructor comments to reflect new parameter.
timeline.author: barustum
azabbasi

timeline.bodyText: Update comment header to include new parameter
timeline.author: barustum
